Description: Postcard; printed paper; monochrome (black and white) photograph showing the Palace Hotel at Heliopolis.
Producer name: Published by: The Cairo Postcard Trust
Curator's comments: Old card; postally unused. Message reads: "2- they failed me so I took it myself in the end. We had two hours solid from 7:30 to 9:30. I am waiting for the train to take me to Ismailia where I intend posting this. The weather is very damp - a very heavy arose in the night & everything is uncomfortably wet. My clothes were wringing wet this morning & it makes me feel very uncomfortable. Well, dearest, I haven't received any letters since last Sunday - I do hope there is one from you today at I[smailia]. We don't get any news here now except just stray pieces which do not seem very bright ..." Correspondence begins on EPH-ME 2980, continues on EPH-ME 2981 and concludes on EPH-ME 2982. The first card is dated October and the final card contains a reference which implies that the correspondence dates to 1916.
